definition[0]: to decide not to continue with a plan, idea etc, although you might continue with it at a later time
example[0]: Plans to reopen the school have been shelved.
definition[1]: land that shelves is at a slight angle
example[1]: The garden shelves gently towards the sea.
definition[2]: to put something on a shelf, especially books
example[2]: Plans for the project have been shelved.
example[3]: The company agreed to shelve its 300 billion warrant-bond issue.
